Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler is concerned about the outfield in Dharamsala.
Ben Stokes is set to miss Tuesday's match against Bangladesh due to a minor hip issue.
The International Cricket Council (ICC) has given the outfield an 'average' rating, allowing it to host World Cup matches despite concerns.
Former England batter and Afghanistan head coach Jonathan Trott questioned the condition of the outfield after spinner Mujeeb ur Rahman narrowly escaped injury.
Bangladesh spin bowling coach Rangana Herath said they were happy with the outfield on which they beat Afghanistan and would not instruct their players to avoid sliding.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed concerns about the integrity of the game given the state of the outfield.
Buttler mentioned that the poor outfield raises questions about the integrity of the game as players are advised to be careful while fielding.
Buttler acknowledged that England did not play well in their last game and are eager to improve.
Buttler stated that England's October 15 contest against Afghanistan in New Delhi looks like a more realistic target for Stokes to return to action.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in Dharamsala is one of the world's most picturesque.
The ground was set to host the third Test between Australia and India earlier this year but was stripped of hosting rights due to the condition of the outfield.
Australia is set to play just one match in Dharamsala, against unbeaten New Zealand on October 28.
